text: live updates for derbyshire and east staffordshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 monday with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

text: the skies will be relatively clear overnight with some scattered cloud .
expect frost tonight with lows of 0c ( 30f ) .

author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: your comments : 'missed over two weeks of school '
text: earlier on we told you about the effects the teaching assistant strikes have had on pupils with special needs .
one mum who 's child attends a special needs school commented on facebook .
louise greenhoff said : `` my son attends st giles school and so far he has missed over two weeks of school due to the strikes , which has impacted on him .
`` it has also cost me financially in additional childcare costs and general disruption having to leave work in the middle of the day to collect him .
`` if mr banwait seriously thinks this is not impacting families in the city then he is living in cloud cuckoo land quite frankly ! ! ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: teenager jailed for 18 years for murder
text: a teenager who was found guilty of murdering a man in normanton last year has been given a life sentence .
mohammed ibrahim,19 , was told he 'll serve at least 18 years in prison at derby crown court today .
he stabbed 51-year-old richard bernard to death on his doorstep in may .
author: Rory Gallimore
BBC Radio Derby

author: Khia Lewis-Todd

text: our radio presenter twiggy gave sally pepper a surprise visit this lunchtime after it was announced butlers in the buff were recruiting .
hey i think he would get a job no problem !
nice bow tie twig .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: long eaton teenager found
text: casey mckeown has been found safe and well in the nottinghamshire area .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: funeral service of claire nagal
text: derby cathedral was filled with family and friends of claire nagal who was murdered last month .
she was found with fatal injuries at a house in borrowash .
today 's service has seen claire 's loved one 's turn out to pay their respects .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : a38 blocked
text: the a38 in burton upon trent is currently blocked and traffic is stationery northbound at branston interchange , because of a jackknifed lorry .
congestion continues up to barton-under-needwood .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: company fined for hydrant misuse
text: a derbyshire company has been fined thousands of pounds after admitting taking water from severn trent 's hydrants .
cpj environental ltd , based in ashbourne , was warned in 2014 about the offence but was prosecuted after repeated hydrant misuse .
severn trent said `` people who take water illegally from their hydrants do n't realise the massive impact it has on our customers . ''
author: Rory Gallimore
BBC Radio Derby

text: wow !

thank you for sending this in .

documents.title: home game for derby county on saturday
text: derby county will face reading this saturday at pride park - kick off is at 15:00 .
rams trio marcus olsson , ikechi anya and cyrus christie are all back in training after injury and may feature , but striker david nugent is a doubt .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: jamie ward returns to forest
text: some sad news for brewers fans .
jamie ward has returned to nottingham forest from his loan spell at burton albion .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: tom webb 's best friend : 'violence is n't the answer '
text: on the anniversary of the death of tom webb , his friends took to the streets of derby to raise more awareness of knife crime .
the 22-year-old from alvaston was stabbed to death on st peter 's street a year ago yesterday .
one of his best friends , daniel powell , said they 're gathering signatures for a petition to tackle knife crime .
speaking to radio derby earlier , he said : `` even helping one person would be massive , just making one person realise not to carry knives around .
violence is n't the answer . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bakewell 's anti-trump poster
text: a quote from martin luther king will be hung from a bridge in bakewell today as donald trump is sworn in .
the banner which reads `` bridges not walls '' will be hung from the footbridge between the town and the agricultural centre .
it refers to the wall donald trump has pledged to build along the us border with mexico .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council 'doing best to minimise disruption '
text: the city council says it is doing its best to minimise disruption .
unison said tas have little option but to strike because new contracts could see them about £ 6,000 worse-off a year .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing teenager from long eaton
text: casey mckeown , who is 17 , has been missing since last friday .
she was last seen at her home in long eaton .
the teenager is white , 5ft 3ins tall , of a slim build and has long dyed red hair .
she was wearing a black nike padded jacket , black leggings and black nike trainers .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: claire 's nagle funeral : 'death was surreal '
text: claire 's mother joy paton says the enormity of what happened on that day was difficult to accept .
speaking to radio derby eariler she said : `` it 's a nightmare , it was surreal , things like this only happen on the news , you would never in a million years think that it would happen to you .
`` then you just come crashing down of course , we still do n't believe it really . ''
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: strike action 'hurting special needs families '
text: teaching assistant strikes have been going on for a while now and some families of children with special needs say they have had enough .
jackie cox says her son max , who has complex medical needs , is having a tough time coping with the disruption .
she says trying to bring in volunteers to help cover staff on strike simply does n't work .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: country park fence smashed
text: so instead of using the path someone has decided to smash through the fence instead .
not the brightest thing to do is it ?
i think someone needs to take up fencing !
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby market hall remains shut
text: derby 's market hall will remain closed to the public today , following the death of a workman .
the 37-year-old has been named as william ball from sandiacre .
he 's understood to have been working high up in the building , before falling .
the hall will reopen to shoppers tomorrow morning .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london midland staff vote over strike action
text: conductors on london midland are voting on whether to take industrial action in a row over the company 's decision to put external security contractors on trains `` by imposition and without agreement '' , the rmt says .
the train line runs through staffordshire meaning services could be affected .
the rail union said the ballot of 523 conductor members opened yesterday and concludes on 2 february .
in a statement the union said the company had `` failed to respond to our questions , proposals and suggestions that would have averted the need for a potential breakdown in industrial relations '' .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: could a derby company be building the hs2 ?
text: the transport secretary has chosen derby to launch the search for a company to build trains for hs2 .
chris grayling was at balfour beatty on stores road yesterday .
the deal for 60 trains and the contract to maintain them is worth £ 2.75bn .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: funeral for borrowash woman being held today
text: the funeral is being held today for claire nagle , the mother of five who died after being found with serious injuries at a house in borrowash .
her husband vincent died shortly afterwards when he was hit by a lorry on the m1 .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader
